physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. There are six people in the photograph. The man in the center is bent over a table, signing a book. The others are standing around him casually. There is a long table in the foreground of the photograph. In the background, the room is decorated with framed documents and photographs mounted on the walls. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of group signing visitors' book
subject_terms_2: Photographs Photograph albums Souvenir Lowe, George, 1924-2013 Hillary, Edmund, 1919-2008 Guest books
